Class StatsPrinter

All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable, sim.engine.Steppable
public class StatsPrinter
extends java.lang.Object
implements sim.engine.Steppable

Utility class to periodically dump statistical output from simulation to flat files.

See Also:

Constant Field Values
Method Detail

instance

public static StatsPrinter instance()
Acquire the singleton StatsPrinter object, and delete the existing contents of OUTPUT_DIRECTORY.

step

public void step(sim.engine.SimState state)
Dump a snapshot of statistical information to flat files.
The directory OUTPUT_DIRECTORY will appear, if it doesn't already exist, and its contents cleared. Then, in this directory will be written the following files:
  • One "Ages" file for each country (for this year). The name of the file will be Ages followed by the country's name (with no spaces), the current year, and a ".data" suffix. (For instance, "AgesSouthKorea2028.data".) The file will contain one line for each victim present in that location. Each such line consists of a single numerical field: the victim's current age.
This dump is scheduled to occur once per year, and when step() is invoked, it will schedule itself for the next year.

Specified by:
step in interface sim.engine.Steppable
Parameters:
state - the HumanTrafficking simulation.
